Package com.xebisco.yield

Class AudioPlayer

java.lang.Object
com.xebisco.yield.ComponentBehavior
com.xebisco.yield.AudioPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Behavior, DefaultAxis, Disposable, Renderable
public class AudioPlayer extends ComponentBehavior
The AudioPlayer class is a component behavior that allows for playing, pausing, and manipulating audio clips in a Yield application.

  • Field Summary

    • getPosition

      public double getPosition()
      This function returns the position of the audio player.
      Returns:
      The method `getPosition()` is returning a `double` value which represents the current position of the audio clip. The position is obtained from the `AudioManager` of this application.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(double position)
      This function sets the position of the audio player using the application's audio manager.
      Parameters:
      position - The parameter "position" is a double value that represents the new position of the audio playback in seconds. This method is used to set the position of the audio playback to a specific time in the audio file.

    • getLength

      public double getLength()
      This function returns the length of the audio clip.
      Returns:
      The method `getLength()` is returning a `double` value which represents the length of the audio clip.

    • getAudioClip

      public FileInput getAudioClip()
      The function returns an audio clip file input.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a FileInput object named "audioClip".

    • setAudioClip

      public void setAudioClip(FileInput audioClip)
      This function sets an audio clip and unloads any previous audio clip if it exists.
      Parameters:
      audioClip - The audio file that is being set for the audio player.

    • getClipRef

      public Object getClipRef()
      The function returns the reference to a clip object.
      Returns:
      The method is returning the value of the variable `clipRef`, which is of type `Object`.

    • setClipRef

      public void setClipRef(Object clipRef)
      This function sets the value of the clipRef variable.
      Parameters:
      clipRef - The clipRef value to set.

    • getPan

      public double getPan()
      The function returns the value of the "pan" variable as a double data type.
      Returns:
      The method `getPan()` is returning a `double` value which is the value of the variable `pan`.

    • setPan

      public void setPan(double pan)
      This function sets the pan of an audio object and throws an exception if the gain is not within the valid range.
      Parameters:
      pan - The parameter "pan" is a double value representing the stereo panning of the audio. A value of -1.0 means the audio is fully panned to the left channel, 0.0 means the audio is centered, and 1.0 means the audio is fully panned to the right channel.

    • isPlaying

      public boolean isPlaying()
      This function returns a boolean value indicating whether the audio is currently playing or not.
      Returns:
      The method `isPlaying()` is returning a boolean value. It is returning `true` if the audio is currently playing and `false` if it is not playing.

    • getGain

      public double getGain()
      The function returns the value of the variable "gain" as a double.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a double value, which is the value of the variable "gain".

    • setGain

      public void setGain(double gain)
      This function sets the gain of the audio player and throws an exception if the gain is not within the valid range.
      Parameters:
      gain - The gain parameter is a double value representing the audio gain level to be set. It should be between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 means no sound and 1.0 means the maximum volume.
